unnormalised: ## Automotive: EV Charging Scene Gets a Jhatka!
normalised: ## Automotive: E V Charging Scene Gets a Jhatka!

unnormalised: Looks like the EV charging infrastructure in India is finally picking up pace! Forget those range anxiety nightmares on long drives to Lonavala.
normalised: Looks like the E V charging infrastructure in India is finally picking up pace! Forget those range anxiety nightmares on long drives to Lonavala.

unnormalised: IIT-Bombay just released a report projecting a massive surge in public charging stations by 2025. They’re talking about strategically placed chargers popping up everywhere, from bustling marketplaces in Chandni Chowk to highway dhabas outside Jaipur.
normalised: I I T-Bombay just released a report projecting a massive surge in public charging stations by two thousand and twenty five. They’re talking about strategically placed chargers popping up everywhere, from bustling marketplaces in Chandni Chowk to highway dhabas outside Jaipur.

unnormalised: Remember that scene from "Dil Chahta Hai" where they break down in Goa? Well, soon Farhan, Aakash, and Sameer could just plug in their EV and chill!
normalised: Remember that scene from "Dil Chahta Hai" where they break down in Goa? Well, soon Farhan, Aakash, and Sameer could just plug in their E V and chill!

unnormalised: Several companies are planning to invest heavily, with talks of rapid chargers that can juice up your Tata Nexon EV in under an hour. Costs are still a concern though, with some charging sessions currently costing upwards of Rs. 500.
normalised: Several companies are planning to invest heavily, with talks of rapid chargers that can juice up your Tata Nexon E V in under an hour. Costs are still a concern though, with some charging sessions currently costing upwards of rupees five hundred.

unnormalised: But hey, imagine cruising down the Mumbai-Pune expressway, silently overtaking those noisy old petrol cars! Plus, think of all the money saved on fuel – could be enough for a full-on Bollywood-style destination wedding!
normalised: But hey, imagine cruising down the Mumbai-Pune expressway, silently overtaking those noisy old petrol cars! Plus, think of all the money saved on fuel – could be enough for a full-on Bollywood-style destination wedding!

unnormalised: The government’s also pushing for more rooftop solar integration at charging stations. Free electricity, anyone? The future’s electric, boss! And it’s looking brighter by the day (and cheaper per km!).
normalised: The government’s also pushing for more rooftop solar integration at charging stations. Free electricity, anyone? The future’s electric, boss! And it’s looking brighter by the day (and cheaper per kilometer!).
